document_data.mainbody: '''Tarsellis Meunniduin''' was a minor [[elf|elven]] [[god]] of mountains, rivers, and the wilderness, as well as the patron deity of the [[snow elf|snow elves]].
document_data.Description: Tarsellis appeared as an {{SIAdj|8|ft|long=yes}} tall male elf with blond hair and deeply tanned skin clad in luxurious furs.
document_data.Personality:
[[File:TarsellisSymbol.jpg|right|thumb|250px|The holy symbol of Tarsellis.]]
Tarsellis was a hearty warrior and legendary hunter, yet still deeply devoted to the wilderness and all its creatures. Conversely, he hated the [[drow]] more than anything else.
document_data.Powers: Tarsellis could not be harmed with heat, cold, wind, lightning, or any other natural forces. He could immediately control any [[elemental]] summoned in his presence and, if pressed, could summon all woodland creatures within a {{SI|2|mile|long=yes}} radius to assist him.
document_data.Possessions: Tarsellis hunted and fought with a giant [[spear]] that only he could wield, one that never missed its target.
document_data.Divine Realm: The Lord of the Mountains maintained a [[divine realm]] on the first layer of [[Ysgard]] called the Wild Ride or the Wild Hunt.
document_data.Activities:
Tarsellis spent a great deal of his time and effort roaming the wilds searching for evil creatures or powerful monsters, either to slay them outright or simply drive them from his own domain. He spent the greater share of his time however in the woods and mountains on the [[Prime Material plane]]. 

If one of his worshipers prayed for aid while acting against the drow, there was a slim chance (about one in a hundred) that Tarsellis would send some form of assistance.
document_data.Relationships:
Tarsellis was a solitary figure amongst the [[Seldarine]], considered rustic by the other elven gods. He used to be the superior of [[Solonor Thelandira]], elven god of hunting, as well as a great friend of his, often hunting with him in the days of old before even mortal elves walked the world. However, the two had been embittered ever since Tarsellis fell in love with a dark yet beautiful goddess known as Megwandir. This caused a falling out between the two former friends, for Solonor objected to their romance out of suspicion towards Megwandir, suspicion proved correct when she was revealed to be Lolth.

[[Rellavar Danuvien]], the elven god of protection from the cold, was in a similar situation to Solonor. He also used to serve Tarsellis, but his continued friendship with the Great Archer had strained theirs a bit. Despite this, the Warder Against Elements could count on both Tarsellis and Solonar's help against the machinations of [[Auril]] and [[Thrym]].<ref group="note">"The Seldarine Revisited" names [[Surtr]] as an enemy of Rellavar Danuvien, but calls him "frost giant god" "whose power is based on ice and cold", so presumably confuses him with [[Thrym]]. One day however, the Lord of the Mountain's following amongst the snow elves could end up eclipsed by his former subordinate.

Tarsellis's claims over the forests of mountain ranges also resulted in a rivalry of sorts with [[Rillifane Rallathil]]. He was also allies with [[Fenmarel Mestarine]], the elven god of outcasts, and [[Shaundakul]], the [[Faerûnian pantheon|Faerûnian god]] of travel.
document_data.History:
According to one elven myth, Tarsellis was one of the original elven gods who [[Corellon]] ascended to divnity by giving a unique name.It is unclear if the term "children" here is meant to be figurative or literal.

Before the time of mortal elves and the Weaver's total fall to evil, Tarsellis fell in love with Lolth under the name of Megwandir, the quarrel over her trustworthiness eventually driving him and his former servitor deities apart. More recent tales depicted [[Hanali Celanil]], elven goddess of love, as the one responsible for the rift, but older stories indicated the truth.
